item.title: Signage runing conservation area, 3rd August
item.description:
Where there was once a fine view down the conservation street of Northumberland Place, there is now huge ugly signage disfiguring it. Ridiculous number of instructions on signs makes it hideously out of proportion and impossible for drivers to take in. Local government at its most insane.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 29, Northumberland Place, Bayswater, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipped foam and bin, 3rd August
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Colomb Street, East Greenwich, London

item.title: Overgrown bush blocking pedestrian sight of road. Safety issue, 3rd August
item.description:
At junction of Pitfield St and New North Road, overgrown bush at pedestrian crossing preventing vision of oncoming traffic down new north road. My young son and I almost got hit. Needs cutting back

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Pitfield Street, Hackney, London

item.title: Fly-tipped rubbish and suspected rodent activity behind Gladeswood road, 3rd August
item.description:
There is a significant build-up of fly-tipped waste in the access pathway behind my partner’s garden. This area is not fenced off and has become a regular spot for people to dump household and commercial rubbish. It’s been this way for several months and the issue is getting worse. We’ve recently noticed signs of rodents (either mice or rats), which raises serious health concerns as my young son plays in the garden nearby. Despite being told this is private land, it appears to be a commonly used access route and not maintained by any private owner. I am requesting the Council assess the status of this land and urgently clear the rubbish to make the area safe and clean again.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Halt Robin Road, Lower Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet
